clobber verb [T]
(HIT)
to hit someone or something hard and repeatedly: If you do that again, I'll clobber you (one).
to punish someone: The government is proposing new measures to clobber tax dodgers.
to harm someone financially: The new supermarket is really going to clobber the small local shops.
